text: The following is a list of deaths that should be noted in July 2019. Names under each date are noted in the order of the alphabet by last name or pseudonym. Deaths of non-humans are noted here also if it is worth noting. ==July== ===1=== * Bob Collymore, 61, Guyanese-born British businessman, Chief Executive of Safaricom (since 2010), acute myeloid leukaemia.Safaricom boss Bob Collymore is dead * Norman Geisler, 86, American theologian, co-creator of the Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy, cerebral thrombosis.Died: Apologist Norman Geisler, Who Didn’t Have ‘Enough Faith to Be an Atheist’ * Rolland Golden, 87, American artist.Rolland Golden, noted Louisiana artist, dies at 87 * Oss Kröher, 91, German folk singer-songwriter.Pirmasenser Liedermacher Oskar Kröher ist tot * Sándor Popovics, 80, Hungarian-Dutch footballer (Újpesti Dózsa, Sparta Rotterdam) and football manager (N.E.C., De Graafschap), Alzheimer's disease.Oud-trainer Popovics van De Graafschap en NEC overleden * Sid Ramin, 100, American composer (West Side Story, Too Many Thieves, Stiletto), Oscar winner (1962).Sid Ramin, Oscar-Winning Composer- Arranger, Dies at 100 * Bogusław Schaeffer, 90, Polish composer, musicologist and graphic artist.Zmarł kompozytor Bogusław Schaeffer * Tyler Skaggs, 27, American baseball pitcher (Arizona Diamondbacks, Los Angeles Angels).L.A. Angels Pitcher Tyler Skaggs Found Dead In Texas at 27 ===2=== * Élie Brousse, 97, French rugby league player (Roanne, Lyon, national team).Rugby à XIII : Élie Brousse, le "Tigre de Sydney", est décédé à l'âge de 97 ans * Costa Cordalis, 75, Greek-German schlager singer."Anita" machte ihn berühmt - Schlagersänger Costa Cordalis ist tot * Lee Iacocca, 94, American automobile executive and writer (Where Have All the Leaders Gone?), President of Ford Motor Company (1970–1978) and Chairman of Chrysler (1979–1992), problems caused by Parkinson's disease.Auto Industry Legend Lee Iacocca Dead at 94 * W. Stone, 90, American lawyer and politician, U.S. Senator from Florida (1975–1980) and U.S. Ambassador to Denmark (1991–1993).Richard Stone, Florida's first Jewish Senator since Civil War, dies at 90 ===29=== * Egil Danielsen, 85, Norwegian javelin thrower and politician, Olympic champion (1956).OL-helten Egil Danielsen er død * Enrique Lafourcade, 91, Chilean writer (Palomita Blanca), critic and journalist (El Mercurio).A los 91 años muere el escritor chileno Enrique Lafourcade * Vasil Metodiev, 84, Bulgarian footballer (Akademik Sofia, Lokomotiv Sofia, Dobrudzha Dobrich)Почина Васил Методиев-Шпайдела * Mona-Liisa Nousiainen, 36, Finnish Olympic cross-country skier (2014), cancer.Maastohiihtäjä Mona-Liisa Nousiainen on kuollut * Tuvya Ruebner, 95, Israeli poet and translator.המשורר טוביה ריבנר, חתן פרס ישראל, הלך לעולמו בגיל 95 * Zdeněk Srstka, 83, Czech Olympic weightlifter (1960), stuntman and actor (Poslední propadne peklu).Zemřel herec, kaskadér a sportovec Zdeněk Srstka, bylo mu 83 let ===30=== * Marcian Bleahu, 95, Romanian geologist, writer and politician, Senate (1990–2000).Academicianul Marcian Bleahu a încetat din viață * Nick Buoniconti, 78, American Hall of Fame football player (Miami Dolphins, Boston Patriots) and medical research activist (Miami Project to Cure Paralysis).Hall of Fame LB Nick Buoniconti dies at 78 * Deep Impact, 17, Japanese champion racehorse (Japan Cup) and sire, euthanized. * W. (death announced on this date) * Raffaele Pisu, 94, Italian comedian and actor (Susanna Whipped Cream, Weekend, Italian Style, The Consequences of Love), Nastro d'Argento winner (2005).E' morto Raffaele Pisu * Harold Prince, 91, American theatre director and producer (The Phantom of the Opera, Fiddler on the Roof, West Side Story), multi-Tony winner.Harold Prince Dies: Broadway Legend Who Produced Original ‘West Side Story’, ‘Fiddler’, ‘Phantom’ & More Was 91 * Jean-Luc Thérier, 73, French rally driver.Jean-Luc Thérier est mort ==References== ==Other websites== * The Guardian, UK obituaries * The Telegraph obituaries * Obituaries, Chicago Tribune * Obituaries, Los Angeles Times * The New York Times, US obituaries * The Washington Post obituaries * The Sydney Morning Herald, Australian obituaries *7 Deaths
